title: unesco_heritage_Willandra_Lakes_Region
text:
Name: Willandra Lakes Region. short_description:

The fossil remains of a series of lakes and sand formations that date from the Pleistocene can be found in this region, together with archaeological evidence of human occupation dating from 45â€“60,000 years ago. It is a unique landmark in the study of human evolution on the Australian continent. Several well-preserved fossils of giant marsupials have also been found here.
